intro: Ammodenia oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small, spiny fruits that aid in seed dispersal. Ammodenia oblongifolia is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
